title: quarto-book-builder
text:
(main) index.qmd
setup instructions
Really just workflow / repo hygiene:
Keep branches.yaml on main as the list of chapter branches only
Don’t put main or chapters in there.
Only put user chapter branches you want included in the book:
chapter1 chapter2 lng-europe shipping-atlantic
Enforce “no merges into chapters” via GitHub settings / policy
Mark chapters as a protected branch.
Only allow maintainer pushes; don’t accept PRs into chapters from user branches.
Culturally: “You never open a PR back to chapters; you PR into main only if we ever want to promote something to infra/template.”
When a new chapter is created:
Author does:
git switch chapters git switch -c my-new-chapter # edit docs/, commit, push git push -u origin my-new-chapter
You add my-new-chapter to branches.yaml on main.
Now uv run book-full-build on main will see it, build it, and mount its docs under a new part: in the big book.
git checkout –orphan gh-pages git status git rm -rf –dry-run . git rm -rf . docs echo “quarto-gh-pages-builder” > index.html git add . git commit -am “initial gh-page” git push

title: (main) intro/readme.qmd
text: This project collates .qmds built from git branches into a book.
